trans-unit.source: Represents a security token that is based on the identity of a Windows domain or user account.

Typically, application developers do not need to use the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class, unless a Web service must gain access to details about the Windows domain or user account associated with the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token.
To get the details of the Windows domain or user account, access the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity%2A> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class.
This constructor does nothing, by default.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the Windows user.

This constructor creates a unique identifier for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token and assigns that value to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id%2A> property.
identity is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the Windows user.
This constructor calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Initialize%2A> method to initialize the properties of this class.
A unique identifier for the security token.
windowsIdentity is `null`.
-or-
id is `null`.
Creates a new instance of <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
A unique identifier for the security token.
The authentication type for the security token.
Gets the authentication type for the token.
Returns <xref href="System.String"></xref>.
Releases all resources used by the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref>.
Call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method when you are finished using the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method leaves the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> in an unusable state.

After calling the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method, you must release all references to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> so the garbage collector can reclaim the memory that the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> was occupying.
Always call the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose%2A> method before you release your last reference to the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken>.
Otherwise, the resources it is using will not be freed until the garbage collector calls the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> object's `Finalize` method.
Gets the unique identifier for the security token.
A unique identifier for the security token.

Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class using the specified unique identifier, Windows user, and the first and last instants in time when the security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Initialize%2A> method is called by the constructors for the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class.
A unique identifier for the security token.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Id"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Set the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidFrom"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidTo"></xref> property.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
Sets the value of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.WindowsIdentity"></xref> property.
`true` to create a object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the property.
windowsIdentity is `null`.
-or-
id is `null`.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken"></xref> class.
A unique identifier for the security token.
The authentication type for the security token.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Represents a Windows user.

`true` to create a object that is identical to the windowsIdentity parameter and assign that to the WindowsIdentity property; otherwise, assign the value of the windowsIdentity parameter to the WindowsIdentity property.
Gets the cryptographic keys associated with the security token.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.SecurityKeys%2A> method returns an empty collection, by default.

A <xref href="System.Collections.ObjectModel.ReadOnlyCollection`1"></xref> of type <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.SecurityKey"></xref> that contains the set of keys associated with the security token.
Throws an exception if the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose"></xref> method has been called for this instance.
the <xref href="System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.Dispose"></xref> method has been called for this instance.
Gets the first instant in time at which this security token is valid.
The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidFrom%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the instant in time at which this security token is first valid.
Gets the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
A <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> security token is valid for 10 hours, by default.

The <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken.ValidTo%2A> property is set to the instant in time when the <xref:System.IdentityModel.Tokens.WindowsSecurityToken> class is created plus 10 hours.
A <xref href="System.DateTime"></xref> that represents the last instant in time at which this security token is valid.
Gets the Windows user associated with this security token.
A <xref href="System.Security.Principal.WindowsIdentity"></xref> that represents a Windows user.
